result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad L Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad L Rogers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad L Rogers was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Chad L Rogers was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation- Atty Kara Rolf

IN CUSTDY 
10:39 AM Defendant Chad L Rogers appeared by video, from Iowa County Jail with Attorney Kara M Rolf in court.  Attorney Rebekah M Rennicke appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of no contest to counts 1, 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS:  Ct 1- 940.19(1) Misd Battery

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Counts 2, 4  . 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 60 days  in Dane County Jail, with Huber; to commence F/W 
 cc to Iowa County case 2018CF143

COUNT 3 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; 
CS to count 1;  CC to Iowa County case 2018CF143

-court authorizes sentence to be served in Iowa County Jail 

-Days credit for time served:  138 days
-Days credit to jail: 138 days

COURT COSTS:
Ct 1, 3
-DA surcharge-ct 3
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W and DA surcharge due w/in 60 days. 
 

-DNA on file


-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant pleas not guilty, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Trial Judge - Br 13

09:52AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney (certified intern)  Peter Rakke with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests counts 1&2 be found transactionally related. No objection from defense. Court so finds.  Witness J.W. duly sworn and testified. Direct by State. Venue established. Defendant identified. Cross by Atty Rakke. State moves for bindover, gives argument. Atty Rakke objects to bindover, waives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over to branch 13.

01:33 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
